title: India's highest paid villain charged ₹200 crore for one film, more than even Shah Rukh, Salman, Prabhas, Ranbir Kapoor - Hindustan Times
summary:
Yash Becomes India's Highest Paid Villain with ₹200 Crore Fee

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Kannada superstar Yash has set a new record as the highest-paid villain in Indian cinema, earning ₹200 crore for his role in the upcoming adaptation of Ramayana.

  • Yash's fee surpasses Bollywood superstars such as Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Prabhas.
  • His role in Ramayana sees him portray Ravana, elevating him to the highest-paid antagonist position in Indian film history.
  • This fee is significantly more than typical Bollywood hero salaries, which hover around ₹100-150 crore.
  • Yash's success marks a shift in the Bollywood landscape where villains are now earning higher than heroes.
“The ₹200 crore Yash is taking home for Ramayana is no mean feat.”

This milestone reflects changing dynamics in the film industry, highlighting the growing value of antagonist roles.
newTitle: Yash Becomes India's Highest Paid Villain with ₹200 Crore Fee

title: Baby John Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking: 119% Jump In Ticket Sales But Far From Fighter & Bollywood Biggies Of 2024! [1 Day To Go] - Koimoi
summary:
Baby John Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking: 119% Jump In Ticket Sales But Far From Fighter & Bollywood Bi

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Koimoi

Varun Dhawan is turning our Santa this Christmas season as he is all set to greet us with Baby John. Co-starring Keerthy Suresh, the action thriller is enjoying good hype across the nation. Advance booking sales are also showing positive signs and are growing with each passing day.

Pre-Sales for Opening Day

Baby John has registered advance booking sales of 1.22 crores, with Maharashtra contributing 19% of the total pre-sales. Nearly 40K tickets have been sold, marking a 119% increase in ticket sales in the last 24 hours.

Baby John vs top advance sales of 2024

Currently, Baby John will not make it to the top 5 advanced booking sales of 2024 due to required sales being out of reach.

  1. Pushpa 2: 91.24 crores
  2. Kalki 2898 AD: 55.30 crores
  3. Devara: 49.90 crores
  4. The GOAT – 28.90 cr gross
  5. Guntur Kaaram – 24.90 crores

The action thriller's success is heavily reliant on word-of-mouth, aiming for a solid opening.

Advance Booking At National Chains

Baby John has sold 25K tickets at major national cinema chains, and with one day left until release, it is expected to see further growth.

Note: Box office numbers based on estimates and have not been independently verified by Koimoi.
newTitle: Baby John Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking Shows Significant Growth

Justin Baldoni's prestigious award for woman advocacy taken back days after Blake Lively's sexual harassment lawsuit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Justin Baldoni's Award Rescinded After Blake Lively's Harassment Lawsuit

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Justin Baldoni, known for his role in 'It Ends With Us', has lost a prestigious award he received for advocating for women and girls, following a sexual harassment lawsuit filed against him by co-star Blake Lively.

  • Baldoni received the Voices of Solidarity Award on December 9 from Vital Voices for his advocacy work.
  • The award was rescinded after Lively’s lawsuit alleging Baldoni's “disturbing” conduct.
  • The lawsuit includes damaging communications from Baldoni to his publicists regarding Lively.
  • Blake Lively has garnered substantial support from the film community, including statements from Sony Pictures and SAG-AFTRA.
  • Baldoni has been dropped by his agency, WME.
“The communications among Mr. Baldoni and his publicists included in the lawsuit... are, alone, contrary to the values of Vital Voices and the spirit of the Award.” - Vital Voices

This incident highlights significant issues surrounding sexual harassment in the entertainment industry and the importance of supporting victims.
newTitle: Justin Baldoni's Award Rescinded After Blake Lively's Harassment Lawsuit

title: Sandhya 70mm stampede victim Sritej’s latest health bulletin - 123telugu
summary:
Health Update on Sritej, Victim of Sandhya 70mm Stampede

Published on: Dec 24, 2024 8:30 am IST

Sritej, a 13-year-old boy who suffered severe injuries in a stampede at the Sandhya 70mm theater during the premiere of Pushpa 2, is currently receiving treatment at KIMS Cuddles in Secunderabad. His latest health bulletin indicates significant improvements.

  • Sritej is maintaining stable vital parameters.
  • He is now off oxygen and ventilator support.
  • Fever spikes have decreased and white blood cell counts are showing improvement.
  • He is tolerating feeds well.
  • Tragically, Sritej lost his mother, Revathi, in the stampede.
  • Allu Arjun’s team and government officials are in regular contact with Sritej’s father regarding his recovery.
  • Allu Arjun was arrested and later released on bail related to the stampede incident.
“He continues to be off oxygen and Ventilator. His fever spikes have reduced and blood investigations have been showing serially improving WBC and CRP trends. He is tolerating feeds well.”

The community and fans are optimistic about Sritej's recovery as he continues to receive care and support during this challenging time.
newTitle: Health Update on Sritej, Victim of Sandhya 70mm Stampede

Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema - Hindustan Times
summary:
Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The passing of Shyam Benegal, a legendary filmmaker and pioneer of Indian parallel cinema, has evoked heartfelt tributes from prominent figures including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu.

  • Benegal passed away at the age of 90 due to chronic kidney disease.
  • PM Modi expressed his condolences, saying Benegal's storytelling profoundly impacted Indian cinema.
  • President Murmu highlighted his role in creating a new genre of cinema and recognized his numerous awards, including the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.
  • Tributes poured in from various celebrities and political leaders, reflecting on his immense contribution to Indian cinema.
  • He was remembered for films like Ankur, Manthan, and Mandi, which reshaped Indian filmmaking.
“His contribution to the development and glory of Indian cinema is invaluable.” - Devendra Fadnavis, Maharashtra Chief Minister

Shyam Benegal's legacy as a filmmaker will continue to inspire future generations in the world of cinema.
newTitle: Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema

title: Diljit Dosanjh, Bryan Adams: Indians angry at concert facilities - BBC.com
summary:
Indian fans fed up with paying top prices for stinking toilets and traffic jams at concerts

Date: October 2023 Source: BBC News

Indian concertgoers are growing increasingly frustrated with the poor facilities at major music events. Attendees at recent concerts, including those by Diljit Dosanjh and Bryan Adams, have voiced complaints regarding sanitation, crowd control, and the high cost of tickets.

  • Concert attendees reported minimal crowd control and unsanitary conditions at venues.
  • Overloaded mobile networks hindered communication and raised safety concerns during events.
  • Many fans expressed dissatisfaction with transport logistics, facing severe traffic jams after shows.
  • Despite the burgeoning concert industry in India, facilities have failed to keep pace with growing demand.
  • Concerts generate significant revenue, with expectations for a growth increase of 25% by 2025.
  • High-profile artists have hinted at refusing to perform again unless infrastructure improves.
“You pay so much for a ticket and what do you get in return? A possible urinary infection and a bad headache with some bouts of music.” - Amrita Kaur

As the Indian concert scene anticipates upcoming performances from major artists, fans hope for improved facilities and experiences at future events.
newTitle: Indians Express Frustration Over Concert Facilities
